Recipe.title: BBQ Spare Ribs
Recipe.Source: From the kitchen of Bobbi Beagley
Recipe.Description: When Jennie was growing up, her mom used to make a wonderful BBQ spare rib recipe. After we were married, she shared the recipe with us, but when we made it, it turned out totally different. It turns out that instead of using Tomato Paste, like the recipe calls for, she always used Tomato Sauce, so it was runny and didn't taste as good.

section.instruction: In a skillet, brown Ribs over high heat.
In slow cooker, mix all other ingredients to create sauce.
Remove ribs from skillet and place in slow cooker, gently rolling ribs until they are coated in sauce.
Cook on high for 2-3 hours, or on low for 4-6 hours.

Notes.note: CAUTION: If you over-cook the ribs they will begin to fall apart, and you end up with shredded BBQ pork or beef.
When serving the ribs, the extra sauce tastes wonderful over baked potatoes, with a dollop of sour cream.

Modifications.modification: This is a wonderful recipe when prepared in a Dutch Oven!
